text.sentence: What's New: On the heels of several AAPL related preannouncements last week, ADI reported preliminary FQone results well below expectations after the close.
Revenues are expected at dollar seven hundred forty five seven hundred sixty fiveM, reflecting weaker than expected customer demand in the company's portable consumer business .
Management further noted this weakness began in December and is expected to continue into FQtwo, although core markets of Industrial, Automotive and Comm.
ADI now expects lower GMs at ~sixty two percent but that is partially offset by lower opex at dollar two hundred sixty fourM .
Interest and Other Expense also increases to dollar tenM given the recent debt offering.
Management will discuss FQone results on its call scheduled for February seventeen, two thousand sixteen.

Our Take: The announcement underlines the well understood weakness in AAPL's supply chain, but also reinforces our belief that ADI's shipments were ahead of those builds creating a larger correction vs. others.
As we noted in our DG, we believe initial yield issues for the Force module caused ADI to ship extra units to multiple supply chain partners therefore compounded the AAPL correction.
While we noted in our preview an opportunity for some AAPL names after the cut, ADI is stuck with company specific issues which may take until FQtwo to resolve.
Given a lack of positive vector in AAPL with no iPads, coupled with tougher Industrial data, the road could be tough through two thousand sixteen.
Net net, even some recovery in ADI's core business won't be sufficient to offset weakness in Consumer and we prefer to stay on the sidelines.
Our price target moves to dollar fifty five based on sixteenx CY seventeenE EPS of dollar three.thirty

We see less upside to estimates given our view that Force touch may not be included in the iPads in two thousand sixteen but remain EW given the nice dividend yield and the potential for more aggressive capital returns/M and A. Upside case USD sixty five.

Our upside case of dollar sixty five is based upon sixteenx our upside CY seventeenE EPS of dollar four., which assumes above industry growth, core OpM expansion, and/or Force touch adopted in the iPads at AAPL.

Our downside case of dollar forty four is based upon sixteenx our downside CY seventeenE EPS of dollar two.seventy five, which assumes limited core margin improvement, and lower ASPs/unit volumes and/or socket loss for Force touch chips at AAPL.

Guide to the Barclays Fundamental Equity Research Rating System: Our coverage analysts use a relative rating system in which they rate stocks as Overweight, Equal Weight or Underweight relative to other companies covered by the analyst or a team of analysts that are deemed to be in the same industry .
In addition to the stock rating, we provide industry views which rate the outlook for the industry coverage universe as Positive, Neutral or Negative .
A rating system using terms such as buy, hold and sell is not the equivalent of our rating system.
Investors should carefully read the entire research report including the definitions of all ratings and not infer its contents from ratings alone.
Stock Rating Overweight The stock is expected to outperform the unweighted expected total return of the industry coverage universe over a twelve month investment horizon.
Equal Weight The stock is expected to perform in line with the unweighted expected total return of the industry coverage universe over a twelvemonth investment horizon.
Underweight The stock is expected to underperform the unweighted expected total return of the industry coverage universe over a twelve month investment horizon.

Rating Suspended The rating and target price have been suspended temporarily due to market events that made coverage impracticable or to comply with applicable regulations and/or firm policies in certain circumstances including where the Investment Bank of Barclays Bank PLC is acting in an advisory capacity in a merger or strategic transaction involving the company.
Neutral industry coverage universe fundamentals/valuations are steady, neither improving nor deteriorating.

Below is the list of companies that constitute the industry coverage universe: U.S. Semiconductors Analog Devices Broadcom Corp. Cypress Semiconductor Corp. Atmel Corp. Cavium Inc. Integrated Device Technology, Inc. Avago Technologies Ltd. Cirrus Logic Inc.
M/A COM Technology Solutions Holdings, Inc. MagnaChip Semiconductor Maxim Integrated Products NXP Semiconductors NV SanDisk Corp.
Texas Instruments, Inc. Distribution of Ratings: Barclays Equity Research has two thousand eight hundred twenty eight companies under coverage.
Barclays Equity Research's Top Picks represent the single best alpha generating investment idea within each industry, taken from among the Overweight rated stocks within that industry.
Barclays Equity Research publishes global and regional Top Picks reports every quarter and analysts may also publish intra quarter changes to their Top Picks, as necessary.
While analysts may highlight other Overweight rated stocks in their published research in addition to their Top Pick, there can only be one Top Pick for each industry.
To view the current list of Top Picks, go to the Top Picks page on Barclays Live .

Risks which May Impede the Achievement of the Barclays Research Valuation and Price Target: We believe our forecasts and price target could be at risk for the following reasons: demand for semiconductors slows down; pricing becomes more aggressive and destabilizes; and the company loses share to its competitors.
